name: Brandon W.
review:
If you're a fan of open, flame-grilled burgers, The Chuck Box is a must-visit. This cozy spot may be small, but it packs a big punch when it comes to delivering some of the best burgers in town. The moment you walk in, you're greeted by the sizzling sound of burgers cooking fresh off the grill, and the aroma is nothing short of mouth-watering.

One of the features at The Chuckbox is their condiment bar. It's a burger lover's dream, allowing you to customize your burger to your exact liking.
The onion rings are #fire--double-fried to perfection, resulting in an irresistibly crispy texture that pairs wonderfully with the juicy burgers.

The staff here are genuinely friendly and add to the welcoming atmosphere. Despite the small space, they manage to keep things moving smoothly, even during the busy lunch and dinner hours. However, because of the limited seating, be prepared to sit outside if the place gets crowded. For two people, you can expect to spend around $20-$30, which is a great deal considering the quality of the food and the overall experience.

PS - place is cash only!! Although, there is an ATM on site if needed.

name: Shiona B.
review:
The food was quite expensive for three persons. We ordered three burgers and two sides and a 16oz beer and large drink.
I dislike the items being sold separately like the fries, onion rings, and burgers and drink. On top of that tax was $3. I wish they could get there prices right when paying. I didn't appreciate the up charge price on two of the big burgers. They took two extra dollars from me when the menu states the burger to be $8.35 each but I charged more.
The man at the till with the mustache and deep voice talked reluctantly rude but tried to make it seem okay but it wasn't.
Other than that it's a nice place to watch food be made in front of you. And wait in line to receive order.
There is a food bar for burger toppings and condiments.
The place is very nice and calm. Not loud. No music. Just smell like burgers.

name: Lenore B.
review:
Get ready for an experience! The Chuck Box has been around since 1972 and they cook over an open mesquite fire. Warning, this place is cash only! They do have an ATM available inside the restaurant, but it's better to come prepared with cash in hand.

There is limited seating inside, but honestly, it's part of the charm of this place. When temperatures are more agreeable, there are some tables to sit at outside of the restaurant. It is very rustic inside, and you stand in line and order at the counter. It reminds me a lot of the Seinfeld episode The Soup Nazi. Don't worry, the line moves pretty fast.

Of course they serve up fantastic tasting burgers and recently I decided to go for the hot and spicy chicken breast sandwich. It was phenomenal. There is a condiments bar so you are able to dress your burger or chicken sandwich however you would like.

If you're visiting Arizona State University or Tempe Arizona for the first time, you definitely should check this place out.

name: Steven B.
review:
Got the Tijuana torpedo and onion rings. Burger was juice and onion rings were crispy. Burger is cooked in front of you as you wait.
Great experience!

name: Kimberly H.
review:
Love these delicious burgers! Have tried several times to eat here but there was always a line! Finally got a chance to experience these BIG burgers and surprisingly the line moves fast!
Definitely got stuck in the smoke from the grill after I ordered...just do what I did and stand super close to the person in front of you and strike up a conversation!
I got the great Big 1/2 pounder with some of the onion rings and I'm not afraid to say it, but I finished every bite! I don't want to leave anything behind! I love being able to put my own toppings on as well! Looking forward to my next visit!

name: Susan H.
review:
I came across a list of the best burgers in each state. For Arizona, The Chuck Box was listed as the state's best. Before we went to AZ, I asked our son-in-law if he had ever been there. After all, it's been in business for 40 years. Even though he grew up in the area, he had never heard of it. When I mentioned seeing it on the best burger list, he was interested in trying it.

First of all, I want to mention that it is cash only. They do have an ATM on site if you need cash.

We were all eager to try the burgers. Ordering works this way --- upon entering, you get in a cafeteria-like line. Then you give your order to the person making the food. They cook their burgers on a grill where mesquite is used. Yes, it all smelled good.

We all gave our orders. Once you do that, you can't advance in the line until your burger gets handed to you. While we were waiting, a woman who was ahead of us in line with her family, started waxing poetic about the burgers saying they were the best they've ever had. Plus, she talked about how clean they kept the kitchen area (we concurred with that). She also mentioned how nice the staff was and one person had been working there for 40 years (Yes, the staff was nice).

Things get somewhat complicated once you get your burger. If you order a side like onion rings or fries, no one tells you to just grab a serving as you move along the line. Thus, my husband didn't grab his onion rings but was charged for them. Drinks are self serve.

How were the burgers? Sorry to say but they weren't that good. They are thin and we all commented how they were dried out with little flavor. That said, the onion rings (which I shared with my husband) were actually quite good. The batter clung to then quite well and they were crunchy with good flavor.

The dining area is rustic --- wooden tables and (if I recall correctly) stools. We felt a bit cramped.

In the end, we spent over $80 to feed 6 of us. Trust me...there are better burgers in AZ.

name: Bailey L.
review:
Honestly, I cannot believe it took me 10 years to check The Chuck Box off my AZ food card. I even use to work RIGHT next door, constantly smelling the greasy deliciousness. It seems like a right of passage in Tempe - located right in between Campus and basically DT Tempe this little hole in the wall is a great spot.

It's very rustic, wooden shack type vibes. The outdoor patio sports log stumps as seats, not the most comfortable, but fit the bill! The inside had seating and it's counter style, made to order. The menu is straightforward featuring various size of burgers and a few specialty ones, with a large self serve topping area, featuring all the classics. This is no gourmet burger shop, this is picnic, classic, served on paper plates food. They have tasty fries and other fried sides such as jalapeno poppers - DELISH - onion rings and also have chicken tenders for those who are not burger people. They have a couple basic beers, by the bottle and pitcher and all the prices are about as cheap as you could get today! 1/2 Burger is about 8 dollars with small upcharge for cheese.

this place is BOPPING, in no way did I ever expect such a crowd. The line was long and the place does get packed, but it moved relatively speedy and you get your burgers before you pay and sit down.

The parking lot is also pretty tight and packed, so something to expect. They also have two small restrooms. it's a great spot for a group or quickish bite!

name: Michelle A.
review:
Flew in from Vegas for Innings fest 2024 and had The Chuck Box bookmarked on Yelp as a place to check out.
I was staying nearby and my Hotel had a full kitchen and provided breakfast daily, so I almost did not have a reason to go to Chuck Box, other than me being an omnivore, luckily one day before the festival I stopped in to Starbucks for a coffee and as I exited I noticed an older looking wooden house and saw the name Chuck Box on the exterior.

Excited, I checked my pockets and had cash on hand, rare occurrence for me these days, so I took that as a sign and went in, as you enter you see a table full of condiments (reminded me of a salad bar) from, mayo, jalapeños, pickles, ketchup, etc, just about anything you can think of adding to a burger.

The interior itself is fairly small, maybe 10-12 tables from my quick glance around the restaurant, but there is also seating outside.
The line can get quite long but I can see why, the burgers and food are cooked to order over a charcoal flame, the food was on point as well as the price, check it out and bring cash!

name: Jessica I.
review: Eh. It was on a couple travel guides, I think because how long it's been around, but truthfully it was just ok. The patty was thin and onion rings were not memorable. There's a ton of other places to eat on this street alone - would recommend going elsewhere.

name: Rigo V.
review:
The Chuck Box
6455 E Southern Ave Mesa, AZ
January 05, 2024

Food: 5/5
Service: 5/5
Portion size: 5/5

Visit description: Dine-in order, Came to Chuck Box one of our valley favorites for a great burger.

Food: We got 2 little one's and 2 orders of fried zucchini with drinks.

Service: Customer service was great especially for how busy it was atleast 15 people in line when we showed up, food was ready in less than 20 minutes and the food quality was top tier, very fresh food along with condiments bar. All the food is prepared to order nothing is ready that's was a plus.

name: Tim O.
review: It's a decent burger, yes. But don't believe the "top 10 in phoenix" lists. Not even top 20. I totally get this place is ranked so high due to nostalgia, but objectively speaking, the burger is nothing special and not worth an out of the way pilgrimage. Picture a burger king whopper from the 90's. That's exactly what to expect.

name: Tina W.
review:
Definitely a cool place to go. Burgers were fantastic atmosphere was good.
Just a cool little place

name: Kristi Z.
review: Loved this place. All outdoor seating though so beware of the birds. Cool vibe, nice people, and seriously the food was INCREDIBLE. Highly recommend and we will definitely go back.

name: Elliot S.
review: Love the burgers and love the service here. This will always be one of our go-to's. Some people may complain about the size of the building or seating availability, but that's what I like about it. It's small, clean, and always delicious.

name: Derek L.
review:
Chuck Box. What a spot, bring cash. Prepare to wait for a moment during busy times as everything is cooked right in front of you at the location.

Great food and you can put anything you want on your burger once it's served to you. Tons of options for food and drinks. We really enjoyed going here and the burgers are reasonably priced and quality!

name: Paul M.
review:
This is a great burger! Straight forward burger cooked on mesquite with nice char marks (without being burnt). You stand in a line and basically tell your order to the person there, they stick toothpicks in the bun so the guy cooking knows what to make and when you get up to the front of the line you pickup your food.

We got two little ones and one big one along with a side of beer battered zucchini. The fun thing about getting a big one is that when you get up to get your food and the person says "you got a big one?" You can confidently say "Yes. Yes I do."

There's a condiment bar to add all your toppings. We all thoroughly enjoyed our burgers, they're really a step above anywhere I can think of. The beer battered zucchini was excellent as well. I got a 16 oz beer as well which was good. Overall an amazing burger that somehow doesn't sit heavy in your stomach.

name: Jamie W.
review: The food here is amazing and cooked right in front of you. We have tried so many burger places in the Phoenix area and this is always our go to!

name: Luis P.
review: Was excited to try out this place since I saw it on other platforms. You walk in and you can smell the burgers cooking. Then we placed our order I had the great big one with 3 sides onion rings, fried zucchini and battered mushrooms. I'll speak about the food. They have a condiment bar, which is nice because you can create a monster burger if wanted but the only veggie one that was a miss, was the lettuce chopped to thick and it was kinda browning. It literally falls off the burger. The burger was really good can't complain. But all the sides tasted like the oil was old & burnt. This giving it a bad taste. But the mushrooms were the best of three. The dining room was clean but extremely smoky. The place is a bit warm for this time of year. My rating for the 3 stars is because I enjoyed the burger. Now for the bad they definitely needed to work on their manners, while eating, you can hear their conversations and way too many F BOMBS were dropped. Then you have employees who man the stations on their cell phones and no washing of hands or switching gloves. The concept is great, the burgers are good but I recommend takeout and to watch the line cooks for sanitary practices. This establishment only takes CASH and they do have an ATM onsite.

name: Joel J.
review: Classic Tempe burger joint. The charbroiled burgers are perfect, and the beer is ice cold. Cash only, there is a ATM inside. Don't mind the line, it moves quickly and it's worth the wait

name: Bradey T.
review: Burgers and beers before ASU graduation is as BIG as it gets! 3rd generation Sun Devil eating with 1st & 2nd generation Devils! Great service and a fun place to eat!

name: Amber G.
review:
So this was a fun experience but it's a one and done for me. The food was excellent. The prices were good. Watching your food be made is always a treat. The staff was so nice and friendly. How they do all those orders so quickly is amazing.
It was a good burger, but nothing out of this world. The spot was crowded. It's obviously a popular place to eat. I am not a fan of the toppings bar. Just everyone touching it- ya no. (But I'm a little bit of a germaphobe) Also it is CASH ONLY.

name: Liana M.
review:
How have we not been here yet??? The Chuck Box has been on my Yelp list for a long time, and we finally ventured in on a Saturday evening. The line was really long, and we relied on other customers to let us know what we needed to do - stand in one line to order, then move to another line to get your food. Although unconventional, this method was HIGHLY effective. We didn't wait too long at all, and the line was constantly moving.

The burgers were fantastic - I had a bacon cheeseburger with cheddar cheese. I loved every bite. The fries were also delicious. My husband opted for the double big one and fried mushrooms. The mushrooms were not my vibe - they were fried perfectly to a crisp but lacked flavor.

The building itself is really old and not clean at all. Maybe it's cleaner during a less busy period of the day. We ate outside, the only place we could find a table. The toppings bar is also in the center, where the line wraps around, so you have to wiggle your way in to get whatever toppings and condiments you want. The staff did a good job replenishing, and I could see plenty of ice underneath to make sure the toppings/condiments didn't go bad, but the other customers were so friggen messy. Have some common courtesy, people!

name: Beth W.
review: My husband has been ranting about this place so it was fitting that he brought me to try it this visit to AZ. I had the Guacamole Bacon Burger and my husband had the Tijuana Torpedo burger with green chiles and pepper jack cheese. It took me a minute to take in how the restaurant works...place your order at the front, watch while they make your order on the grill (pretty impressive how the man grilling kept all of the food moving!). Then you pay - they are a cash only business - and then there is a food bar with toppings you can add to your burger. Think the typical items - lettuce, tomato, pickles, peppers, etc. You'll also find condiments for your fries, onion rings, or fried zucchini if you decide to go that route. There is limited seating at the very rustic, cozy, restaurant. The burger was delicious and I can see why this is one of my husband's favorites when we come to town.

name: Lucia M.
review: Very solid burger, and the ability to add your own toppings is great. Just very pricey.

name: Dharma K.
review: their jalapeño poppers are amazing. the food is fresh but they only take cash which is the only downside.
